result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Robert Kostohryz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and commits no other crimes during the probation term.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead to Count 2.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and the possible penalties.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 2.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated as to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 2 - Domestic DC.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.  CC .  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and commits no other crimes during the probation term.  Court costs, including DNA surcharge.  No sample required.
